div.head: ESR to EDA
div.p: I will answer some of your questions soon - just now the inroad of new & old students is overwhelming & I have no brains left after planning courses for all sorts of people.

I copied your letter & sent to Mrs Abel & here is an extract from hers received in the same mail. The food question will be the question inside of five years & you may well be proud of having been a pioneer

note.p:
Written in Ellen Richards’s Hand, copied from Mrs. Abel’s Letter-->
Extract from Mrs Abel

Appropos of a letter that has come to me asking for anything that will tell our readers how they can obtain more nutritious and less expensive food my husband offers this suggestion, That many classes of Americans must learn to spend more rather than less proportionally to other outgoes on proper nourishment especially for skillful preparation and variety, that there is too general a feeling that if hunger is satisfied for the time that is all sufficient and all saved beyond what is clear gain. He feels sure that explains many cases of defficient vigor and that in our artificial and
brain and nerve wearing life we cannot afford to despise high art in cookery and even the many course dinner and on these grounds he defends wine and beer at meals. He has met a great many Americans in the last year and he thinks most of them look underfed. Some who were going to take the Constantinople trip and were buying no end of trinkets were horrified at spending more than a mark for dinner. He took one of them in hand and made him feed up as you did Miss Palmer and with the best results especially in the quality of his work.
